titleStmt.title: To ROBERT BELL,Robert Bell (1800-67; Dictionary of National Biography), journalist and miscellaneous writer; best known for his Annotated Edition of the English Poets, 29 vols (not 24 vols as given previously), 1854-7: see Pilgrim Letters 1, p. 543 & n. He had served under CD on the Charter Committee which reported to the Royal Literary Fund on proposed reforms, 1855. 30 MARCH 1857

sourceDesc.p: Extract in J.A. Stargardt, Berlin catalogue 2003; addressed Robert Bell; dated Tavistock House, 30 March 1857.

body.p: …I have such an agreeable remembrance of my last very pleasant visit to you,Unidentified; unlikely to have been the meeting so long ago as Apr 55 suggested at Pilgrim Letters 8, p. 305 n.5. and of my great enjoyment of your hospitality, that I am vexed to be under an engagement to dine at Gravesend next Tuesday.CD was at Gravesend from 7-15 Apr, while he oversaw building works at Gad’s Hill. It is, however an engagement— and a grim business one to bootUnidentified business connected with Gad’s Hill.—and you know the reliability of your old manager.Bell had acted in the amateurs’ production of Not So Bad as We Seem, 1851: see Pilgrim Letters 6, p. 385n. (I will be as disagreeable at Gravesend as I possibly can).
